question:
Some events on Earth happen instantly while others take thousands of years to occur. Which process takes the longest time to complete?

Choices:
 (A) movement of small pieces of rock by flowing water
 (B) weathering of a rock to form small rocks and sand

A student places a sheet of black construction paper on her desk. What happens to most of the light that strikes the black construction paper?

Choices:
 (A) The light is absorbed by the paper.
 (B) The light passes through the paper.

Birds eat non-camouflaged moths at a higher rate than they eat camouflaged moths. In which situation would birds eat the moths at the slowest rate?

Choices:
 (A) dark moths in a light environment
 (B) light moths in a light environment

During a presentation on astronomy, Professor Williams discussed various measurements in space. Which objects was she referring to when she talked about how astronomical units (AU) were determined?

Choices:
 (A) the Moon and Earth
 (B) the Sun and Earth

Scurvy is a disease that sailors often got on long voyages. It was discovered that scurvy could be prevented by eating oranges and lemons. This suggests that scurvy is a disease caused by

Choices:
 (A) a microorganism
 (B) a nutritional deficiency

Which of the following remains constant in Earth's carbon cycle?

Choices:
 (A) the total mass of available carbon
 (B) the physical state of carbon-containing molecules

Which is a process that occurs during photosynthesis?

Choices:
 (A) Plants take in carbon dioxide and release oxygen.
 (B) Plants take in oxygen and release sugar.

What goal does taxonomy accomplish?

Choices:
 (A) predicts the types of undiscovered organisms
 (B) classifies living organisms into groups

If a tall tree falls over in a crowded forest, which resource becomes available to the surrounding plants?

Choices:
 (A) sunlight
 (B) air

Some students were on a tour exploring the inside of a cave. While the students were in the cave, they realized they heard an echo every time that they spoke. Which most likely caused the echo to occur?

Choices:
 (A) the refraction of the sound waves
 (B) the reflection of the sound waves

Which of these would best help a scientist discover a new planet?

Choices:
 (A) asking questions to other scientists
 (B) looking at the night sky with a telescope

Arteries and veins are two important parts of the circulatory system. What is the relationship between arteries and veins?

Choices:
 (A) They work independently to relay messages.
 (B) They work together to transport nutrients.

Hereditary information is transmitted from parents to offspring through

Choices:
 (A) genes.
 (B) germination.

Which of the following best describes a mineral?

Choices:
 (A) a solid natural material with a crystal structure
 (B) a material that was once living but has decayed

In New York State, an observer will usually see the Sun rise in the

Choices:
 (A) south
 (B) east

Sugar is added to water and the mixture is stirred. Which observation is evidence that the sugar dissolved in the water?

Choices:
 (A) Less sugar is visible.
 (B) The sugar turned into crystals.

Which pair of items will repel each other?

Choices:
 (A) a negatively-charged plastic strip and a negatively-charged piece of cloth
 (B) a positively-charged wool sock and a neutral plastic bag

The energy obtained from food is measured in units called

Choices:
 (A) Calories
 (B) degrees

Which human trait is most likely inherited from a parent?

Choices:
 (A) reading a book
 (B) height

How do plants most commonly break large rocks into smaller pieces?

Choices:
 (A) Plant leaves insulate surrounding rocks from extreme temperatures.
 (B) Plant roots grow into cracks in rocks.

In order for a glider to fly, its weight must be opposed by

Choices:
 (A) lift.
 (B) drag.

Vein deposits of gold and silver are often formed in areas that have experienced which geologic process?

Choices:
 (A) compaction by pressure
 (B) igneous intrusion

Toads lay their eggs in ponds. Tadpoles hatch from the eggs and eat the plants floating in the pond. Which resource is most important for toads to survive?

Choices:
 (A) water
 (B) trees

What causes the soil in a flood plain to be generally rich in nutrients?

Choices:
 (A) new soil deposited by the river
 (B) warm water from an ocean

Which of these dissolve in water?

Choices:
 (A) Sugar cubes
 (B) Sand grains

Felicia investigated whether water color affected how fast the water heated in sunlight. She poured tap water into five beakers and placed food coloring in four out of the five beakers. Felicia then used a thermometer to measure the temperature of the water in each of the beakers. Which of these was used as control in her investigation?

Choices:
 (A) testing the beaker of uncolored tap water
 (B) using the same amount of water in each trial

Which outcome is most likely if a person consumes more Calories than needed for daily activities?

Choices:
 (A) weight loss
 (B) weight gain

Which statement describes a method of sexual reproduction that occurs in plants?

Choices:
 (A) Stem cuttings are placed in water and grow roots.
 (B) Seeds are produced from the flower of the plant.

Research into the total amount of oil available for use around the world can affect what kind of human choice?

Choices:
 (A) how to travel to work
 (B) whether to recycle glass and aluminum

Which did Thomas Edison invent?

Choices:
 (A) light bulb
 (B) compass

Which of the following best describes the climate of an area?

Choices:
 (A) the average temperature and total precipitation each month for ten years
 (B) the high temperature and wind speed each day for one year

When compared to current average conditions, which term would best describe conditions in Earth's lower atmosphere if greenhouse gases were absent?

Choices:
 (A) denser
 (B) cooler

A recycling plant manager needs to melt 1500 kg of scrap copper to sell to a wire manufacturer. The copper is at 15°C and its melting point is 1083°C. The copper has a specific heat of 385 J/kg x K. How much heat is required to raise the temperature of the copper to its melting point?

Choices:
 (A) 7.9 x 10^8 J
 (B) 6.2 x 10^8 J

Which of the following helps the body to cool down?

Choices:
 (A) running a fever
 (B) sweating

A soccer player kicks a soccer ball across a field. Which factor has the most effect on the distance the soccer ball travels?

Choices:
 (A) the force of the kick
 (B) the temperature of the air

Which type of rock is formed when hot lava cools?

Choices:
 (A) igneous
 (B) metamorphic

Lori owns a house next to the lake. She uses lots of fertilizer to keep her lawn green. Which impact could fertilizing her lawn have on the lake?

Choices:
 (A) an increase in the algae population
 (B) an increase in the fish population

Multicellular organisms grow in size by producing more

Choices:
 (A) organs.
 (B) cells.

Evaporation, condensation, and precipitation are all processes which occur in the

Choices:
 (A) water cycle.
 (B) energy cycle.

Which of the following is the best estimate of the number of stars in a typical galaxy?

Choices:
 (A) billions
 (B) thousands

Which change in the environment would have a negative effect on the survival of a species in an ecosystem?

Choices:
 (A) decrease in the population of predators
 (B) introduction of a competing species

The directions for making a protein

Choices:
 (A) are carried by DNA.
 (B) result in amino acids.

What is involved in creating genetically modified bacteria?

Choices:
 (A) using biotechnology techniques
 (B) changing their food source

Before rock can become soil, it must undergo certain processes. One process in the formation of soil involves plants. How can plants chemically change rocks into soil?

Choices:
 (A) They increase the density of the rocks.
 (B) They weather rocks with acid.

Which of the following is an example of how insects are beneficial to humans?

Choices:
 (A) Insects pollinate flowering plants.
 (B) Insects sometimes eat poisonous plants.

In a mixture, a magnet is used to separate some particles from sand. The dark particles are most likely made of which element?

Choices:
 (A) copper
 (B) iron

A metal spoon was left in a pot of boiling soup. The cook burned a finger by touching the spoon. Why did the finger get burned?

Choices:
 (A) The metal spoon chemically reacted with the cook's hand.
 (B) The metal spoon conducted heat to the cook's hand.

NASA's Kepler Mission has collected information about main-sequence stars with characteristics similar to the Sun. What is the most common color of these stars?

Choices:
 (A) yellow
 (B) blue

Most of Earth's major earthquakes are caused by

Choices:
 (A) faulting of rock in Earth's crust
 (B) seasonal heating and cooling of Earth's surface

Which activity is necessary for humans to maintain good health?

Choices:
 (A) resting
 (B) talking

The Grand Canyon is an example of

Choices:
 (A) an earthquake.
 (B) erosion.

Which resource has the most potential for production of renewable electric energy?

Choices:
 (A) geothermal
 (B) coal

Two scientists doing the same experiment got different results. Which would be the best way to figure out which result might be correct?

Choices:
 (A) A group of scientists should vote.
 (B) More scientists should do the experiment.

Which of these best defines the term "pollutant"?

Choices:
 (A) any substance that is harmful to the environment
 (B) a substance that does not break down over time

In the human body, cellular respiration breaks down sugar molecules after they enter the cell. What results from this process?

Choices:
 (A) release of energy
 (B) growth of bacteria

What is the main function of a plant stem?

Choices:
 (A) to absorb water and plant nutrients from the soil
 (B) to carry food and water to the rest of the plant

Growing thicker fur in the winter helps some animals to

Choices:
 (A) keep warm
 (B) attract a mate

Which statement is an opinion?

Choices:
 (A) Chemistry and Physics are major branches of science.
 (B) Life Science is a subject filled with interesting information.

An eagle is a bird that reproduces by laying its eggs in a dry nest. Which animal lays its eggs in a place most similar to the eagle?

Choices:
 (A) reptile
 (B) amphibian

Noah studied different systems in the human body. Which best describes a function of veins in the circulatory system?

Choices:
 (A) carrying blood from the body to the heart
 (B) passing waste materials from the blood to outside the body

Sharpening a pencil and tearing paper are examples of physical changes. Which statement describes why these are physical changes?

Choices:
 (A) There is a change in both the appearance of the objects and the materials from which they are made.
 (B) There is a change in the appearance of the objects.

After which event will ecological succession most likely happen?

Choices:
 (A) a forest fire
 (B) a lunar eclipse

In 1933, a hurricane came ashore at Ocean City, Maryland. A hurricane negatively affects a coastline by

Choices:
 (A) causing erosion
 (B) increasing the growth of grasses

Sleet, rain, snow, and hail are forms of

Choices:
 (A) precipitation
 (B) evaporation

Which two body systems work together to transport oxygen to the cells?

Choices:
 (A) digestive and respiratory
 (B) respiratory and circulatory

Which of the following is most likely to cause water to change from one state of matter to another state of matter?

Choices:
 (A) a change in air temperature
 (B) a decrease in wind speed

How do most fish get the oxygen they need to survive?

Choices:
 (A) Using their gills, they take in oxygen that is dissolved in water.
 (B) They take in water and break it down into hydrogen and oxygen.

Which scientist studied biology by traveling by ship to different islands observing animal life, and developed a hypothesis about how species change?

Choices:
 (A) Albert Einstein
 (B) Charles Darwin

Which of these is the most responsible for the changes of the seasons on Earth?

Choices:
 (A) Tilt of Earth on its axis
 (B) Temperature of the Sun

Sandy and Keith plan to move a 6-kilogram block. If they wanted to calculate the mechanical energy required to move the block, what units would they use to report their answer?

Choices:
 (A) volts
 (B) joules

At science conventions, scientists present their research, and members of the audience can discuss or ask questions about the research. The main value of these science conventions is that they allow scientists to

Choices:
 (A) exchange their ideas.
 (B) see new places.

Which method could be used to separate a solution of table salt and water?

Choices:
 (A) filtration
 (B) evaporation

When can producers make the most food?

Choices:
 (A) summer, because there is more sunlight
 (B) summer, because there is more heat

Which characteristic is inherited rather than learned?

Choices:
 (A) having blue eyes
 (B) saluting the flag

Jonny climbed an apple tree. How are Jonny and the apple tree similar to each other?

Choices:
 (A) Both are made of cells.
 (B) Both take in carbon dioxide.

Which of these cycles takes 24 hours?

Choices:
 (A) Earth rotating on its axis
 (B) Earth revolving around the Sun

Fossils of clam shells were found in the Appalachian Mountains. Which of these statements best explains why the clam shells were found in the Appalachian Mountains?

Choices:
 (A) The mountain range was once under water.
 (B) Birds flying overhead dropped the clam shells.

The part of the rock cycle that transforms compressed rock formed from sea organism shells into a harder, denser rock is

Choices:
 (A) metamorphic rock becoming igneous rock.
 (B) sedimentary rock becoming metamorphic rock.

The number of fish in a lake suddenly increases. How will the increase most likely affect the lake?

Choices:
 (A) More frogs will live in the lake.
 (B) There will be fewer insects in the lake.

After a race, a newspaper lists the names of the five fastest runners. Another method that could be used to identify the five fastest runners is to make a chart that shows the

Choices:
 (A) time it took each runner to run the race.
 (B) total distance for each runner.

The aloe plant can absorb a lot of water during a rain shower. The extra water is stored in its leaves. The ability to store water in its leaves is most likely an adaptation to which type of environment?

Choices:
 (A) one with dry conditions
 (B) one that receives a lot of sunlight

Students conducted an investigation with green bananas. They hypothesized that an onion placed near a banana could increase the rate at which the banana ripened. They placed one onion and one banana in each of three containers. In a fourth container they placed a banana, but no onion. Which statement best explains why the onion was left out of the fourth container?

Choices:
 (A) The onion would contaminate the fourth trial.
 (B) The container without the onion is the control.

Different systems of the human body perform different functions. Which system takes oxygen from the air to be moved by the circulatory system?

Choices:
 (A) the digestive system
 (B) the respiratory system

The mathematical model for calculating speed is shown below. Speed = distance/time. An airplane traveled 700 kilometers in two hours during a trip. What was the average speed of the plane during the trip?

Choices:
 (A) 84,000 kilometers per hour
 (B) 350 kilometers per hour

Which characteristic below most likely accounts for our limited knowledge of galaxies?

Choices:
 (A) their great distance from Earth
 (B) their magnetic cores

What are the products in the chemical reaction below? NaOH + HCl -> NaCl + H_{2}O

Choices:
 (A) sodium chloride and water
 (B) sodium, chlorine, and water

Which is an example of a chemical change?

Choices:
 (A) a rusting car fender
 (B) a melting popsicle

All of the processes listed below cause changes in Earth's surface. Which of the following is the slowest to change Earth's surface?

Choices:
 (A) weathering
 (B) landslide

Light travels fastest through which of the following?

Choices:
 (A) glass
 (B) a vacuum

Students perform an investigation designed to measure the daily growth of a bean plant. Which should the students do every day of this investigation?

Choices:
 (A) form conclusion
 (B) record data

A scientist studies the remains of two extinct animals to learn more about how they lived. She determines that one animal was a carnivore and the other was an herbivore. Which of the following did the scientist most likely compare to make this conclusion?

Choices:
 (A) the number of bones in the animals
 (B) the skull of the animals

Choices:
 (A) the skeletal and muscular systems
 (B) the circulatory and respiratory systems

Malaria is a common disease in many countries. What is the cause of this disease?

Choices:
 (A) a bacterium
 (B) a parasite

All living things need energy to survive. What is the primary source of energy for all living things?

Choices:
 (A) the sun
 (B) the wind

Which of these are broken down during chemical, but not physical, changes?

Choices:
 (A) elements
 (B) compounds

A chef uses a metal spoon to stir noodles cooking in a pan. After five minutes, she notices that the thermal energy from the pan has made the spoon

Choices:
 (A) wet.
 (B) hot.

The functions of a plant's roots are to support the plant and

Choices:
 (A) make food
 (B) take in water and nutrients

Choices:
 (A) neutron star
 (B) red giant

Choices:

 (B) by releasing carbon into the atmosphere

Which of the following best represents one particular stage in a life cycle?

Choices:
 (A) a fish swimming
 (B) a seed sprouting

A light bulb manufacturer claims its light bulb is "twice as bright" per unit of electrical energy consumed as the leading light bulb. If this claim is correct, what factor must be accurately compared between the two bulbs?

Choices:
 (A) how much each bulb weighs
 (B) how much heat each bulb releases

Which seismic wave phenomenon, found at structural boundaries, allows scientists to interpret the interior structure of Earth?

Choices:
 (A) transformation of mechanical waves into electromagnetic waves
 (B) refraction of waves

Discarded electronic devices, such as outdated computers and cell phones, contain materials that can be toxic to the environment. Which statement best explains why humans continue to use these technologies?

Choices:
 (A) Some areas have recycling programs for electronics.
 (B) Humans value the benefits of these devices over their cost.

Steven went to a farm and picked a bright red tomato from a broken branch on the plant. The tomato had a rotten spot with a worm inside of it. Instead of eating the tomato, Steven decided to plant the seeds and grow new tomato plants. Which characteristic of the tomato plant is inherited and could change over several generations?

Choices:
 (A) color of the skin
 (B) size of rotten spots

Choices:
 (A) history and processes of Earth.
 (B) types of minerals that make up sediments.

A science class is taking a field trip to a forest to observe and study birds. Which tool would be most helpful for observing birds?

Choices:
 (A) binoculars
 (B) beakers

Which event would most likely result in more food for organisms that are scavengers?

Choices:
 (A) Fish die and sink to the bottom of a pond.
 (B) Plants get more sunshine and water.

A science class investigated the percentage of corn kernels that pop in bags of different brands of popcorn. Fifteen students tested three brands of popcorn each and reported their results to the class. Why did the teacher most likely have so many students report the results?

Choices:
 (A) for more accurate results
 (B) for more student participation

The water in a pond gets colder one night. Which tool is best to observe its temperature change?

Choices:
 (A) balance
 (B) thermometer

Choices:
 (A) solar winds bringing high-energy particles toward Earth

Choices:

Which of these renewable resources results in an increase in pollution when used to produce energy?

Choices:
 (A) water
 (B) biomass

The best evidence that two land areas were once connected is the discovery that both land masses

 (A) have the same climate.
 (B) have similar types of rocks and fossils.

All of the following are functions of a cell membrane except

Choices:
 (A) producing energy for cell processes.
 (B) surrounding and protecting the contents of the cell.

Which process will separate the sugar from a mixture of sugar and water?

Choices:
 (A) Evaporating the water
 (B) Stirring the mixture

Barry collected four different rocks. The rock with the GREATEST mass will feel the ___.

Choices:
 (A) heaviest
 (B) smoothest

Variation in which property between water at different temperatures contributes most to the formation of horizontal ocean layers having distinct temperatures?

Choices:
 (A) density
 (B) acidity

Which type of energy in gasoline is transformed into mechanical energy in a motorcycle engine?

Choices:
 (A) chemical
 (B) magnetic

Which statement is a description of weather?

Choices:
 (A) The temperature is 55° F in Winslow today.
 (B) The Sun will set in Yuma today at 6:45 p.m.

Which environmental stimulus causes leaves on certain trees to change color in autumn?

Choices:
 (A) competition for survival

Henry and Emily are building a tree house. Which tool should be used to measure the height of the door?

Choices:
 (A) stopwatch
 (B) meter stick

Which ability is the most useful for making observations?

Choices:
 (A) creativity
 (B) senses

The floating arrow on a compass always points towards the

Choices:
 (A) east.

Choices:
 (A) stopwatch and camera

Vinegar and water are placed in a container and stirred. What is formed when they are mixed?

Choices:
 (A) solution
 (B) solid

A star is a large astronomical body that

Choices:

Choices:
 (A) a compound

Which instrument should a student use to best examine bacteria?

Choices:
 (A) computer probes
 (B) microscope

Which of these is a way the people of Virginia can help restore a natural ecosystem?

Choices:
 (A) Plant native plants
 (B) Feed leftover meals to deer

Which is an example of light being reflected?

Choices:
 (A) looking into a mirror
 (B) taking a picture

Which material is primarily a mixture of weathered rock and organic matter?

Choices:
 (A) ocean water
 (B) soil

The items listed below were found in a science classroom. * a heart made of plastic with many of its parts labeled * clay formed to look like Earth and other planets * a giant plastic plant cell with removable cell parts These items are all examples of

Choices:
 (A) controls
 (B) models

Which kind of rock is produced by deposition and cementation?

Choices:
 (A) sandstone, a sedimentary rock
 (B) marble, a metamorphic rock

What is involved in creating genetically modified bacteria?

Choices:
 (A) using biotechnology techniques
 (B) growing them on selected plants

Which area is coldest?

Choices:
 (A) reef
 (B) tundra

Sally is making candy on the stove. She places a thermometer in the candy. What is she measuring?

Choices:
 (A) temperature
 (B) speed

Choices:
 (A) mechanical energy
 (B) chemical energy

What is the primary job of red blood cells?

Choices:
 (A) remove waste

Choices:
 (A) tornadoes
 (B) acid rain

Hydrochloric acid is added to a beaker containing a piece of zinc. As a result, zinc chloride is formed and hydrogen gas is released. This is an example of

Choices:
 (A) a chemical reaction
 (B) a physical change

A loaf of bread is baking in a pan in a 350° F oven. What would cause a burn to a hand the quickest because of its low specific heat?

Choices:
 (A) the metal pan
 (B) the surface of the bread

Based on the evidence available at the time, early models of the solar system stated that all objects in space orbited Earth. In the 16th century, an astronomer reevaluated the evidence and proposed a model of the solar system that is still in use. What part of this model corrected the mistake in previous solar system models?

Choices:
 (A) The Sun is at the center of this model.
 (B) This model shows that Earth is stationary.

What does a mirror do to light that causes objects to appear backwards?

Choices:
 (A) refracts
 (B) reflects

Biotic forces can cause changes to the surface of Earth. Which is the best example of living organisms causing weathering?

Choices:
 (A) Tree seedlings growing and forming cracks in rocks.
 (B) Salmon making nests for their eggs in a stream.

Which organ directly works to protect the human body from disease?

Choices:
 (A) skin
 (B) heart

What is the main function of scales on a fish?

Choices:
 (A) to attract predators
 (B) to protect the fish

How does ice change the shape of rocks?

Choices:
 (A) It breaks the rocks by expanding in openings.
 (B) It moves the rocks by pressing on them.

Which example describes a learned behavior in a dog?

Choices:
 (A) sitting on command
 (B) digging in soil

A student had a cup of ice while working outside. After a while, the ice melted because the Sun emits energy in the form of light and

Choices:
 (A) electricity.
 (B) heat.

When an ice cube melts, its state of matter changes from a

Choices:

 (B) solid to a liquid

What form of energy causes an ice cube to melt?

Choices:
 (A) magnetic
 (B) heat

A team of scientists proposed an explanation for the plumes and developed a model. They also published calculations based on their model. These calculations would most likely be used for which purpose in future research?

Choices:
 (A) testing the hypothesis
 (B) evaluating similar events

A volcano under the ocean slowly releases lava over time. As the lava is released, it cools and hardens on the ocean floor. Which feature will most likely form from the release and cooling of the lava on the ocean floor over time?

Choices:
 (A) an island
 (B) a reef

Why do dogs have most of the characteristics of their parents?

Choices:
 (A) They inherit them from their parents.
 (B) They eat the same foods as their parents.

Campers shouted toward a canyon wall. What characteristic of sound best explains why the campers heard an echo?

Choices:
 (A) Sound waves reflected off the canyon wall.
 (B) Sound waves were refracted around the canyon.

Choices:
 (A) energy
 (B) speed

Most stars are similar to each other in

Choices:
 (A) composition.
 (B) temperature.

Which of these is an example of an endothermic process?

In what leaf structure is photosynthetic tissue found?

Choices:
 (A) vascular bundle

Choices:

Choices:

 (B) an electrical conductor.

Choices:

 (B) The rock layers are compressed forming faults and folds.

Most of the concentration of which gas results from the activity of producer organisms?

Choices:
 (A) oxygen
 (B) water vapor

Which equipment will best separate a mixture of iron filings and black pepper?

Choices:
 (A) filter paper

Which object in our solar system reflects light and is a satellite that orbits around one planet?

Choices:
 (A) the Moon
 (B) Earth

Choices:
 (A) boiling the mixture until the water evaporates
